title.native: ドラえもん (2005)

description: A new Doraemon series produced by the same team as the 1979 series (in association with Studio Pierrot) with new voice actors and staff and updated character designs.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/135960980) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yoshimichi_kameda)

After graduating from the Department of Fine Arts, Faculty of Art and Design, Onomichi City University he joined studio [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). 
Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

His animation bears heavy influence from [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) with the added aspect of *Sumi-e* brush painting techniques, resulting in very characteristic lineart. He first attracted attention with his work on [Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood](https://anilist.co/anime/5114/).

Married to [Maiko Okada](https://anilist.co/staff/138501).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B8%A1%E8%BE%BA%E6%AD%A9)

Ayumu Watanabe is a director, screenwriter, storyboard artist and a former animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/binobinobi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/押山清高)

Co-founder and Representative Director of [Studio Durian](https://anilist.co/studio/6283/).

**Height:** 158 cm
**Agency:** Yellow Cab Next

[Profile](http://www.yellow-cab-next.jp/mao-ichimichi.html)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Snow White - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Luka Millfy - Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger (TV Series)
- Raptor 283 - Uchuu Sentai Kyuuranger (TV Series)
- Varesa - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Celestia - Strinova (VG)

[Website](https://www.hoshinogen.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/gen_senden) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/iamgenhoshino/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/genhoshino.official/) | [Youtube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPKlrgZXnnb89nSeITvTdGA/)

A Japanese singer-songwriter, musician, actor, and writer.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fringon/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fringon) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/pedro.alcantara.1610) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@fringontv) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@_fringon) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/fringon)

Pedro Alcântara Machado de Vasconcelos (Jacareí, November 22, 1994) is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, singer and dubbing director. He is the son of voice actor [Ricardo Vasconcelos](https://anilist.co/staff/202508/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Pablo (1st voice - 1st-3rd season; The Backyardigans)
- Beck Oliver (Victorious)
- Tyler Navarro / Dino Charge Red Ranger (Power Rangers: Dino Charge)
- Coby (One Piece Live Action)
- Kim Dong-Ha (Happy Ending)
- Reminald R. "Remy" Remington (Big City Greens)
- Bradley Nicholson (Milo Murphy's Law)
- Charles Ronson (Horizon Zero Dawn)
- Hae-Rang (Sweet Home)
- Howard "Howie" (High School Musical: The Musical: The Series)
- Silas Plaskett (The Walking Dead: World Beyond)
- Charles "Charlie" St. George (13 Reasons Why)
- Ron Stoppable (Kim Possible Live Action)
!~

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/藤子・F・不二雄)

Hiroshi Fujimoto, better known as F. Fujio Fujiko, was part of the former manga-writing duo [Fujio Fujiko](https://anilist.co/staff/219230/).
